results.title: Little houses for little people
results.creator_credit: Micheline Charest, Ronald A Weinberg, Ernest Reid, BRB International, Cinar Films and Miramax Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David tells us more about the magical world of the gnomes. In “Little houses for little people” he explains the gnomes’ secret and special underground houses. “The wedding that almost wasn’t” - All the Gnomes gather to celebrate a wedding - but the trolls are unwelcome guests! Based on “The gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Good medicine; witch way out (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Micheline Charest, Ronald A Weinberg, Cinar Films and Miramax Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David the gnome enters the wonderful world of adventure as he tries to help his fellow creatures out of trouble. This program consists of 2 episodes, ‘Good Medicine’ captures David’s skills as a doctor and ‘Witch Way Out?’ finds David and his faithful fox, Swift, captured by ugly and vicious trolls. Based on the book “The Gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Will Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.creator_credit: Micheline Charest, Ronald A Weinberg, Ernest Reid, Cinar Films and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: A series of videos each containing two adventures of David the Gnome, his wife Lisa and faithful fox, Swift, narrated by Christopher Plummer and animated for the screen from the stories of Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen.

results.title: The World of Watteau
results.brief_description: Looks at the contemporary lifestyle of the French court at the beginning of the eighteenth century through the eyes of the painter Watteau. The refinement and grace of French court life at the beginning of the eighteenth century found its expression in the art of the French painter Antoine Watteau. He captures the rich satins and delicate laces of the courtly costumes, and the play of light, and shade is costumes, and the play of light and shade in the pleasure gardens with a lightness of touch and bold economy of line that foreshadows the Impressionists. But Watteau did more than reflect the surface charm of this world; he sensed the sadness and emptiness of lives spent in endless search of pleasure, a mood that underlines many of his greatest works.

results.title: The World of the unborn. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description: Part 1 of the program explains what happens at the point of conception when the egg and sperm are formed and united. A discussion about DNA and chromosones is also included as well as an examination of the development and changes which occur during puberty. Part 2 examines the development of the fertilised egg as it implants itself in the wall of the uterus and the progression of the embryo to foetus until birth. Also featured are the physiological changes which occur during pregnancy. The photography and computer animation used in the program are outstanding.

results.title: Your child is a genius
results.brief_description: Deals with the creative desire in every child to draw pictures of their impressions of the world about. The psychological and social values in children’s art are stressed. Samples of child art in the Brooklyn Museum are shown.

results.title: Your biological guide to AIDS
results.creator_credit: Stuart McDonald, Katherine Everett and BBC
results.brief_description: Presenters from the Bodymatters Team separate facts from fiction and reveal how much the worldwide experts know about AIDS and its transmission. They explore the challenges ahead and the possibilities of finding a vaccine and a cure. The program dispels some of the myths surrounding the disease and uses giant models of the body to explain the action of the AIDS virus on other healthy cells.

results.title: The Time has come
results.creator_credit: Jamil Simon, Jamil Simon Productions and Women's Action Alliance
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the ease and accessibility of a non-sexist approach to child rearing. Explores the non-sexist elements of the home environment as well as influences from outside the home such as television and school. Suggests ways for parents to expand future options for their children.

results.title: The Time guardian
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Norm Wilkinson, Robert Lagettie, Chateau Productions Investments and International Film Management
results.brief_description: During the 24th Century a new city is launched into time to escape a polluted and dying earth. It must keep travelling to avoid the Jen-Diki, mutated descendants of the people they once were and the city’s natural enemy. After yet another attack, the city is forced to repair and recharge in a safe year and comes to rest in the 20th Century. Stars Tom Burlinson, Carrie Fisher, Dean Stockwell and Nikki Coghill.

results.title: Your biological guide to AIDS (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Caroline Godley, Alison Tucker, Vic Lockwood and BBC
results.brief_description: An informative question and answer format about AIDS presented by Mike Smith and Vicki Licorish. Discusses how the virus is transmitted; what it does to the body; how it affects your partner; the immune system; HIV; condom practice and protection. Includes interviews with AIDS sufferers.
